items.title: Meta Poached Apple’s Pang With Pay Package Over $200 Million
items.description: (Bloomberg) -- Meta Platforms Inc. has made unusually high compensation offers to new members of its “superintelligence” team — including a more than $200 million package for a former Apple Inc. distinguished engineer.Most Read from BloombergSinger Akon’s Failed Futuristic City in Senegal Ends Up a $1 Billion ResortAre Tourists Ruining Europe? items.title: Audiio Hires CD Baby Sync Industry Veteran Brett Byrd To Lead TV/Film
items.description: Audiio.com, a leading music licensing platform powering millions of creative projects worldwide, today announced the hiring of Brett Byrd as Director of Creative Licensing. A seasoned veteran of the sync licensing industry, Byrd brings over 10 years of experience securing high-profile placements for music in film, television, advertising, and branded content.

items.title: Are Analysts Getting Too Bullish on Microsoft and Nvidia?
items.description: It was seven years ago that the market saw its first 1 trillion-dollar company, when Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL) crossed that threshold.  Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT) and Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) are among the most highly valued stocks in the world today.

items.title: Nvidia's $4T market cap: How it reached the milestone
items.description: Nvidia’s (NVDA) market cap just hit $4 trillion, surpassing Apple (AAPL), Microsoft (MSFT), and even Saudi Aramco (2222.SR). Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Allie Canal breaks down how Nvidia’s artificial intelligence (AI) chip dominance and rapid growth have fueled this milestone. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime here.

items.title: Nvidia Hits $4 Trillion Market Cap: Buy, Hold, or Take Profits in NVDA?
items.description: Hitting a 52-week and all-time high of $164 a share (post-split basis), Nvidia became the first company to hit a $4 trillion market cap on Wednesday,
